tidybrookes 0.1

    Basic cleanup, checks, and annotation of ADT data

    adt_annotate.Rd

    Performs basic cleanup, checks and annotation of ADT data with indexes for the hospital visit (visit_index) and the visit to each departments (department_visit_index), and basic labels for each department.

    Usage

    adt_annotate(x, fixed_labels, annotate_fn)

    Arguments

    x

    Tidy ADT data, as tidied by adt_rename()

    fixed_labels

    A data frame with a colum department, which will be joined to the ADT data

    annotate_fn

    A function that provides additional annotation

    Value

    The supplied tidy ADT data x with additional annotations

    Details

    The clean and checks performed are:

    1. Removes duplicate rows

    2. Checks discharge dates are identical within a visit

    The annotations added are:

    1. Labels hospital visits via visit_index

    2. Adds the end_datetime for each row of ADT (which is not always included in the raw data)

    3. Labels visits to specific departments. A visit to a single department may involve multiple rows of ADT data, since a patient may move beds within a department one or more times. The visits are labelled with department_visit_index, and the corresponding times recorded in department_start_datetime and department_end_datetime, and department_length_days.

    4. (Left) joins in fixed_labels

    5. Runs the user-supplied annotation function annotate_fn

    See also

    adm_annotate() annotates ADM data

    Author

    R.J.B. Goudie

    Examples

    fixed_labels <-
  tibble::tribble(
    ~department, ~is_ed,
    "ADD EMERGENCY DEPT", TRUE,
    "ADD C2 WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD D2 WARD", FALSE,
    "DIALYSIS CENTRE", FALSE,
    "ADD A1 WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD A2 WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD A3 WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD A4 WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD X WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD Y WARD", FALSE,
    "ADD Z WARD", FALSE)

adt_data_example <-
  read_tidybrookes_csv(
    file = tidybrookes_example("adt.csv"),
    col_types = "adt"
  ) %>%
  adt_rename
#> Warning: The following named parsers don't match the column names: ADT_SERV_AREA_NAME, HOSP_SERV_NAME
#> Warning: One or more parsing issues, call `problems()` on your data frame for details, e.g.:
#>   dat <- vroom(...)
#>   problems(dat)
#> ! Some columns were missing: ADT_SERV_AREA_NAME and HOSP_SERV_NAME

adt_data_example %>%
  adt_annotate(annotate_fn = identity,
               fixed_labels = fixed_labels)
